intro: Restio durus, commonly known as the hard restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a grass-like plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and tall, cylindrical inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing small, inconspicuous flowers. Restio durus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to withstand coastal conditions.
